recipes.title: Veggie Stew
recipes.method: 1. Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas 5. Place the carrot, leek and tofu in a large bowl. Add the stock and mix well. 2. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. 3. Place the mixture in a large bowl and cover with a lid. 4. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 40 minutes. 5. Serve with a slaw of your choice

recipes.title: Veggie Pizza
recipes.method: 1. Pre-heat the oven to 200C/3C/gas 5. Add the pasata, green pepper and mushrooms to the base. Place the lid on the oven and cook for 30 minutes. 5. Serve with a slaw of your choice

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
recipes.method: 1. Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella into 1/4-inch thick slices. 2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating and overlapping. 3. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices. 4. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil. 5. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Quinoa Salad
recipes.method: 1. In a large bowl, combine quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, and olives. 2. Drizzle with fresh lemon juice and olive oil. 3. Toss gently to combine. 4. Season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Eggplant Parmesan
recipes.method: 1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. 3. Bake eggplant slices until tender. 4. In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, baked eggplant slices, mozzarella, and parmesan. Repeat. 5. Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with fresh basil.

recipes.title: Spinach and Mushroom Quesadillas
recipes.method: 1. In a pan, sauté spinach and mushrooms in olive oil until wilted. 2. Add black beans and cook until heated through. 3. On a tortilla, sprinkle cheddar cheese and spoon the spinach, mushroom, and black bean mixture. 4. Top with another tortilla. Cook on a griddle until cheese is melted. 5. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and guacamole.

recipes.title: Chickpea Curry
recipes.method: 1. In a pan, sauté onion and garlic until softened. 2. Add chickpeas, coconut milk, tomatoes, curry powder, and turmeric. Simmer until flavors meld. 3. Serve over cooked basmati rice. Garnish with cilantro.
